parameterdescription.para: The name of the file with full path containing information to read, for instance the LaTeX header of the document: 'user/config/japhug.tex'.

simplesect.para: A Python string containing read information.

parameterdescription.para: The targeted Lexical Entry LMF instance.

simplesect.para: A string representing the references in LaTeX format.

detaileddescription.para:
Note that the lexicon must already be ordered at this point. Here, parameters 'items' and 'sort_order' are only used to define chapters.
object
The LMF instance to convert into LaTeX output format.
filename
The name of the LaTeX file to write with full path, for instance 'user/output.tex'.
preamble
The name of the LaTeX file with full path containing the LaTeX header of the document, for instance 'user/config/japhug.tex'. Deafult value is None.
lmf2tex
A function giving the mapping from LMF representation information that must be written to LaTeX commands, in a defined order. Default value is 'lmf_to_tex' function defined in 'src/config/tex.py'. Please refer to it as an example.
font
A Python dictionary giving the vernacular, national, regional fonts to apply to a text in LaTeX format.
items
Lambda function giving the item to sort. Default value is 'lambda lexical_entry: lexical_entry.get_lexeme()', which means that the items to sort are lexemes.
sort_order
Default value is 'None', which means that the LaTeX output is alphabetically ordered.
paradigms
A Python list of LaTeX filenames with full path containing the paradigms in LaTeX format. Default value is an empty list.

para.verbatim: Replace '@xxx' by '\\textcolor{gray}{xxx}' in 'lx', 'dv', 'xv' fields (already in API).
Handle small caps. Replace '°xxx' by '\textsc{xxx}' in translated examples.
Hanlde quotation marks. Replace each "xxx" by ``xxx".

detaileddescription.para:
Transform unique identifier of a lexical entry in ASCII format.
lexical_entry
The targeted Lexical Entry LMF instance.
font
A Python dictionary giving the vernacular, national, regional fonts to apply to a text in LaTeX format.
A string representing the unique identifier in LaTeX format.
